reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in a sea view balcony room. The room was very large, bright and had the most magnificent view of the water. When we checked in we were informed that the room was a french balcony room...I was initially a little nervous as this was our final stop on our Italy vacation and we were looking for R&R and a sea view was very important to us. The balcony is not very big but it did not take away from the wonderful experience. The room was extremeley well kept and the bathroom was large with a wonderful size shower/tub. The hotel and the beautiful grounds surrounding it was so lovely and even better than the website illustrates. The continental breakfast takes place in the restaurant over looking the sea. It is a good buffet and there a plenty of choices available. The service was also very good. The hotel is also in a perfect location to "everything" in Sorrento. Half block to where all of the shopping and restaurants begin. The "center" of town is a few blocks away. This was a trip we had been planning for many years and we were so pleased with the hotel and service that we would definitely recommend to our friends and return to ourselves.
reviews.title: Beautiful Hotel with great service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for 4 nights and had a great time. The reception staff were very helpful, booking hotels and trips for us. We were upgraded to a sea view with terrace and had an amazing view over the bay. The room was clean and tidy and functional - a great base for exploring. Every night we watched the sunset on the bar terrace - look out for Pepe the barman - he was an absolute star and always remembered what we were drinking and brought out some great snacks.
reviews.title: A fabulous hotel - classic and stylish

reviews.text: Sorrento reminded us of a 1960s James Bond movie and the hotel is ideally located by the "drains" of the old town (the narrow old streets).
reviews.title: Wonderful location, breathtaking views

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We would definately go back.
reviews.title: Noisy room with grumpy reception staff

reviews.text: We stayed here by chance as we were meant to stay at La Favourita but they overbooked and moved us here. The location is one if the best in sorrento. The rooms are big. A little dated but fine. The walls are thin so if you have noisy neighbors you will here them. We were quite lucky in this respect. The view from the breakfast room was astounding. Breakfast staff wonderfully friendly and breakfast was also wonderful. The beach is directly below the cliff the hotel is perched on, as well as the port for the ferry service and there are plenty of restaurants and shopping just one street away. Good base to see Capri & Pompeii.
reviews.title: Great location, great views, some rooms much better than others

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were very appy when we were shown to our room, which had a wonderful view of the Bay of Naples. The hotel i old and classy, and the gardens are very well kept. Breakfast was included, and always delicious.
reviews.title: Beautiful Hotel - maybe a little snobbish

reviews.text: Our only two complaints about it are the fees for the internet usage (7 euro, maybe, for an hour?) which was incredibly slow, sometimes taking 3 minutes to load a page and 5 minutes to send an email. The other is the staff at the front desk at times seemed to have an attitude that they were more elegant than they were. I guess there are some Americans (and others) that like that; indeed, one lady had the bell boy walking her two dogs around the garden, which we thought was silly. But it is what it is, and we did have a good time! We borught our own bags to the main lobby upon departure, which surprised me...but it was no big deal, just didn't live up to the elegant attitude they were trying to portray.
reviews.title: Views to Die For

reviews.text: Thanks to Mr. Luigi and the entire staff at Hotel Tramontano for a wonderful stay for our group in May. The Tramontano was our "home" for 6 wonderful days and nights. We never wanted to leave the breakfast room because of the delicious food and the knock-out views.
reviews.title: Best ever

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It is always so hard to leave the beautiful Imperial Hotel Tramontano where I have spent many wonderful visits to Sorrento with my husband. We’ve come at least a dozen times, and several friends have joined us over the years. Among us all, it’s unanimous that this is the place to stay if you’re visiting this charming town. It’s also a perfect location from where you can go to Capri and Pompeii. What an absolutely beautiful spot! The gardens, the lobby, the balcony where you can have drinks and watch the sunset over the water – it’s all fabulous. The staff is unfailingly polite and helpful, which is such a plus when traveling in a foreign country. Every room that we and our friends have stayed in is charming, with local ceramic tiles, comfortable beds, and spotless bathrooms. You can get a beautiful sea view with a balcony or a lovely garden view of rare tropical plants from all over the world: the accumulation of at least a hundred years of plantings, gorgeous flowering shrubs, exotic trees, and beds of flowers. There are tables and chairs throughout this spectacular horticultural setting, which are perfect spots to just sit and read or write postcards. You can either take the lift to swim in the sea below or enjoy the tranquility of the swimming pool that is set in the garden, where you can order delicious salads and pastas for lunch, and snacks later in the afternoon, and feel incredibly pampered. The actual building is quite old and historic, with wonderfully decorated common rooms and charming architectural touches throughout. The kitchen is marvelous! Great buffet breakfasts in the beautiful dining room provide everything from eggs and cereal to delicious pastries and wonderful fruit that you know was just picked. Dinners at sunset are the perfect combination of beautifully cooked and presented local specialties, solicitous service, and a lovely ambience. If you want to try restaurants in town, they are only minutes away because this hotel is so centrally located. The underlying allure of this hotel, what makes you keep wanting to come back, is the way that everyone - from the solicitous general manager and gracious people at the front desk, to the wait staff, porters, maids, and gardeners – makes you feel so at home. You may arrive exhausted and jetlagged, and somewhat disoriented, but the minute you arrive, you feel so welcome and taken care of. That’s when you know you’ve come to the right place.
reviews.title: Paradise in Campania
Disappointed.
reviews.text: We just returned from a wonderful vacation to Rome and the Amalfi Coast and spent three nights at the Tramontano. The location was perfect and the views of the Bay of Naples from both our balcony and bathroom were breathtaking. However, our room was extremely basic and had a strange odor to it.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My biggest issue with this hotel is that while the website promised air conditioning with no conditions, when we arrived and inquired (end of May and very warm), we were told that the hotel did not turn on the AC until June 1st. We were extremely upset and the hotel was very unaccomodating, to say the least.
reviews.title: Superb holiday at the Imperial Tramontano Hotel, Sorrento Italy.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you are simply looking for a good location and great view, Tramontano is a good fit. If you are looking for good staff and comfort, I would encourage you to look elsewhere.
reviews.title: Great location, really enjoyed our stay.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Have just come back from a two week stay at the above hotel. We went with Citalia. The hotel is situated on the top of the cliffs overlooking the Bay of Naples with Vesuvious opposite - far enough away to escape if it misbehaves !! The hotel is quite beautiful and the accommodation on the third floor excellent and overlooking the sea Everyone in the hotel are all very pleasant and easy to deal with. The restaurant also overlooks the Bay with very large windows. We always had a table for two by the windows and the service was excellent. The food was either Table d'ote or a la Carte and we could switch between either as we wished. Breakfast came with the room rate and was always excellent. The Restaurant was open from 7=00pm and the restaurant manager Luigi was kindest himself and always had some amusing remarks to make. Our last night there was made quite special for us by all the staff. The wine list is also very good with a wide selection of wines at all price ranges. We had a car and one asked the Concierge when one was going out and the car was waiting at the door. Similarly it was parked for you on return. On the morning of our leaving there was a strike nearby and we had to leave at 7-15am and so the restaurant was opened from 6-30am instead of 7-00am.
reviews.title: Wonderful location, but.....

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: we visited this hotel in the last week of june. it was a package tour with thompsons and as i am disabled and suffer from multiple sclerosis the location and the facilities are important. the hotel was close to the centre of sorrento and had all its facilities working like lifts and air conditioning. the staff were very helpful and the rooms were very clean. the ambience of the hotel was one of luxury. i would say that the restaurant , though serving splendid food is very expensive however that is true of the whole region. it didnt detract from what is a great experience.
reviews.title: luxury and great service

reviews.text: Hotel is in excellent position for the centre of Sorrento but can be noisy at times. This is not a problem at night. We were at the front of the hotel overlooking the pool. Can be noisy round the pool due to the traffic and general noise from other hotels/shops etc. The view from the restaurant over the bay of Naples and Versuvios was outstanding, excellent position and very nice sunsets. Balcony is very nice position for pre dinner drinks.
reviews.title: Very friendly hotel

reviews.text: Pool area is very good and we had no trouble getting a sunbed when we wanted one. No one got up early to put towels on beds whilst we were there. Often we would arrive back to the hotel around 2pm and always found a bed.
reviews.title: The best location in Sorrento!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Food is excellent and the staff are very very friendly. Room was adequate for our needs, we travelled with elderly parents who did not have great mobility, there were two lifts to all the floors and even down to the sea/beach area. We went to the port on the bus and was able to walk along the beach front back to the hotel to use the lift back up to the hotel.
reviews.title: Room poor but the rest very good

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The whole hotel, pool area and gardens are very clean and tidy. The rooms were tidied every day and the beds made. As stated the food is very good although if you are staying as half board the choices can be limited on the menu, especially the starters but the staff are very accommodating and will offer an alternative. We often had pasta for a starter if we did not like the choice on offer. There is a good choice for breakfast and the manager of the restaurant organised for a packed breakfast on our last morning as were leaving so early.
reviews.title: Beautiful Property with a Great Location,
